UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that represents a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Cationicity Enhancement on the Hydrophilic Face of Ctriporin Significantly Reduces Its Hemolytic Activity and Improves the Antimicrobial Activity against Antibiotic-Resistant ESKAPE Pathogens.
Literature.Author: Luo X, Deng H, Ding L, Ye X, Sun F, Qin C, Chen Z

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 29213(MIC=8µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=8µg/ml),Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 29212(MIC=8µg/ml),Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=8µg/ml),Escherichia coli ATCC 35218(MIC=8µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=4µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 700603(MIC=8µg/ml),Acinetobacter baumannii ATCC 19606(MIC=4µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus(MIC=8µg/ml),Staphylococcus epidermidis(MIC=4µg/ml),Staphylococcus capitis(MIC=2µg/ml),Enterococcus faecium(MIC=4µg/ml),Escherichia coli(MIC=8µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa(MIC=8µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae(MIC=16µg/ml),Acinetobacter baumannii(MIC=2µg/ml)
